column5: Hi - New to the board, looks to be a great site.  My father and I are currently looking to take a trip this summer to B.C for some salmon fishing - likely Queen Charlotte area.  Was wondering if anyone could provide any advise as to location, time of year etc.. or share there experience.  It's quite expensive and we're just wondering if it's worth the $ (I've heard it's quite the experience).  Thanks in advance

Welcome to the board!  definitely worth it depending when in the summer you're going and what exactly ur after?  big tyee from July onward coho and springs start late Sept  I have an excellent contact for Kayak Fishing on the Island. How about kayak fishing for a big halibut?

Were you pitchin for me Nomad...Nice thanks bud Im touched...But we gotta get your butt up here for some butts off the yak...Cant wait to have you for some monster halibut action...The time will come  Keep bustin butt on your ventures...the dream is almost reality bro
It's not mainstream yet, but that's only a matter of time!!
HOLD ON.  all i can say is hooking into a big tyee will tire you out.  By far the strongest fish I have ever battled!
By the looks of things, it's worth every penny!
